title: Ardian Pradipta
text:
I‚Äôm a software engineer, working for AIA Singapore.
The sole purpose to create this blog is to train my ability to write and explain things (well, some will be technical, the other will be casual blogging).
Have something in mind? Drop me a message!

title: Intro
text:
But I don‚Äôt want to just write, I want to customize my own website too!
After hours of looking for free to use template, most of them are waaaay too overkill to create such a simple blog and I decided to go potato, ‚ÄúNah, I won‚Äôt create something so sophisticated, let‚Äôs just use some open source framework to do the heavylifting‚Äù.
Until I found Quarto, it‚Äôs interesting at glance, they offered scientific and technical publishing system.
I‚Äôll give it a try. Why not? After all this blog will be a mix between casual and technical blogging.
They even have syntax highlighter!
System.out.println("Hello World?");



Quarto Image


Not sure why I posted the picture above, I got it from quarto site generator and it looks good, so there you go.

title: Git Fire
text:
This is quite funny, and this might happens to all of us, I think I need to create a post for a reminder to always have alias Fireüî•



In case of fire? Git!


git config --global alias.fire \
'!sh -c "git checkout -b fire-{uid} && \
         git add -A && \
         git commit -m "FIRE" && \
         git push origin fire-{uid}"'
change the {uid} into something that is unique (such as email) after successful addition of command above, we can just run:
git fire
OR we can just copy these commands, either we save it in alias or save it as fire(.bat), and add fire.bat into PATH.
git checkout -b fire-{uid} && git add -A && git commit -m "FIRE" && git push origin fire-{uid}
then we can just run fire.bat in cmd.
At least, this will do. The most important thing in case of fire is git out!
